alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seminole, central Orange and southeastern Volusia Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Lake Helen to 6 miles east of Deltona to College Park. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Deltona, Port Orange, Sanford and Altamonte Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Orange; Seminole
